awd_titl_txt: Intramolecular Cyclization Reactions of Alkynyl Substituted Diazoketones
awd_abstract_narration: The focus of this research is the formation of polycyclic ring                  systems by the interaction of alpha-diazo alkynyl substituted                   ketones with various transition metals.  The initially formed                   ketocarbenoid intermediate is projected to undergo an                           intramolecular addition to the acetylenic pi-bond to produce a                  vinylcarbenoid intermediate.  The latter will be probed to                      study the potential for insertion into C-H bonds, addition to                   pi-bonds, 1,2-hydrogen and alkyl group migration and                            electrocyclization.                                                             %%%                                                                             With this award, the Synthetic Organic Program is supporting                    the research of Dr. Albert Padwa of the Department of Chemistry                 at Emory University.  Professor Padwa will focus his work on                    the development of new synthetic methods for the production of                  carbenoid intermediates and, thus, the preparation of unusual                   polycyclic ring systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
